title: Josh Johnson (rugby league)
text:
Joshua "Josh" Johnson (born 25 July 1994) is an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> soccer-player who plays as a for the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford Red Devils</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Super%20League">Betfred Super League</a>.
He has previously played for the <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield Giants</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>, and on loan from <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a> at <a href="Doncaster%20R.L.F.C.">Doncaster</a> and the <a href="Batley%20Bulldogs">Batley Bulldogs</a> in the <a href="RFL%20Championship">Championship</a>, and <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Oldham%20R.L.F.C.%20players">Heritage № 1340</a>) in <a href="2015%20Championship%201">Championship 1</a>. Johnson played for <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the <a href="2017%20RFL%20Championship">Kingstone Press Championship</a> and in the top flight, and on loan from <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull KR</a> at the <a href="York%20City%20Knights">York City Knights</a> in <a href="2018%20RFL%20League%201">Betfred League 1</a> and the <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a> in the <a href="2018%20RFL%20Championship">Betfred Championship</a>. He also played for the <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow Raiders</a> in the <a href="2019%20RFL%20Championship">Championship</a>.
Background.
Johnson was born in <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a>, <a href="West%20Yorkshire">West Yorkshire</a>, England.
Playing career.
Early career.
Johnson has previously played for the Saddleworth Rangers.
2013.
Johnson made his <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield Giants</a>' <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> début on 4 August 2013, in a match against the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford Red Devils</a> at the <a href="John%20Smiths%20Stadium">John Smiths Stadium</a>.
2013.
Johnson's senior <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> début came during a dual-registration spell at <a href="Part-time%20job">part-time</a>rs <a href="Doncaster%20R.L.F.C.">Doncaster R.L.F.C.</a> in the 2013 season.
2013-14.
In 2013 and 2014, Josh also played as part of a loan deal with <a href="Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">Championship</a> club the <a href="Batley%20Bulldogs">Batley Bulldogs</a>.
2015.
The 2015 season saw Johnson play for the <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">OLdham</a> on a dual-registration basis.
2017.
Johnson made his <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>' début on 2 April 2017, in a 50-16 <a href="Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">Championship</a> league victory.
Johnson was part of the <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>' side that won promotion back to the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>, at the first time of asking following relegation the season prior.
2018-19.
Struggling for regular game time during the 2018 <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> season and with no promise of that changing during the 2019 campaign, it was revealed on 25 January 2019, that Johnson had been released from his contract (to seek regular game time elsewhere) at <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> by mutual consent.
2018.
Josh also featured for the <a href="York%20City%20Knights">York City Knights</a> on several occasions during the 2018 season, as part of <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>' dual-registration agreement with the club.
2018.
It was revealed on 26 July 2018, that Josh Johnson would spend the remainder of the 2018 <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> season at the <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a>, on a loan basis from his parent-club <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>.
Johnson was followed to the <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a> by two of his current <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> teammates in <a href="Will%20Dagger">Will Dagger</a> and <a href="Jordan%20Walne">Jordan Walne</a> as part of the same loan deal.
2019.
It was revealed on 31 January 2019, that Johnson had signed a deal to join the <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow Raiders</a> on a one-year contract, that included a release clause should he receive a full-time offer from another club.
Johnson made his début for the <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow Raiders</a> on 3 February 2019, in a 18–22 victory over the <a href="Batley%20Bulldogs">Batley Bulldogs</a>.
